Interface InputEventListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
GameController
public interface InputEventListener
Defines the contract for handling user inputs and game state triggers.

Design Pattern: Observer / Listener
This interface decouples the Input mechanism (Keys, GUI buttons) from the Game Logic. The KeyManager triggers these events, and the GameController implements them to update the game state.

This abstraction allows the input system to be swapped or modified (e.g., adding joystick support) without changing a single line of code in the core game logic.

  • Method Details

    • onDownEvent

      void onDownEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Triggered when a "Down" command is received. This could be from the user pressing the down arrow (Soft Drop) or the game loop timer tick (Gravity).
      Parameters:
      event - contains metadata about the source of the movement.

    • onLeftEvent

      void onLeftEvent()
      Triggered when the user attempts to move the active piece to the left.

    • onRightEvent

      void onRightEvent()
      Triggered when the user attempts to move the active piece to the right.

    • onRotateEvent

      void onRotateEvent()
      Triggered when the user attempts to rotate the active piece. Standard rotation is counter-clockwise.

    • onHardDropEvent

      void onHardDropEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Triggered when the user presses the "Hard Drop" key (Spacebar). Instantly drops the piece to the lowest valid position.
      Parameters:
      event - contains event source data.

    • onHoldEvent

      void onHoldEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Triggered when the user presses the "Hold" key. Swaps the current falling piece with the piece in the hold slot.
      Parameters:
      event - contains event source data.

    • createNewGame

      void createNewGame()
      Signals that a new game session should start. Resets the board, score, level, and history.

    • getBoard

      int[][] getBoard()
      Retrieves the current board state matrix.

      While primarily an input interface, this method allows the Input/UI layer to obtain the necessary data structure for initialization without coupling to the concrete Controller class.

      Returns:
      the 2D integer array representing the grid.

    • onUndoEvent

      void onUndoEvent()
      Triggered when the user requests to "Undo" the last move. Reverts the game state using the Memento pattern.
